intro: Cissus discolor marmorata, commonly known as the marble cissus, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive variegated leaves, which feature a marbled pattern of green and white. The plant produces small, pale green flowers followed by reddish berries. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardens.
